alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 5:59PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Cherry, northwestern Brown and southwestern Keya Paha Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 559 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Norden, or 14 miles east of Valentine, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Norden, Smith Falls State Park and North River Trail. This includes Highway 12 between mile markers 24 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
